result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L Hendrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted in 15CF279 shall be applied to restitution in this case. Per 11/2015 Amended Restitution Summary & Order restitution amended to $213.47 plus 10% surcharge.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with Andres T. or his residence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: All conditions of Count 1 are inclusive of Count 2.
